greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangular table, read by antidiagonals, where row n is equal to column 1 of matrix power A121412^(n+1) for n>=0.
example: Table of column 1 in matrix powers of triangle H=A121412 begins:
Rearrangement of the upper part of the table forms A121431, which is
the number of subpartitions of partition [0,0,1,1,1,2,2,2,2,3,...]:
program: (PARI) {T(n,k)=local(H=Mat(1), B); for(m=1, k+2, B=matrix(m, m); for(i=1, m, for(j=1, i, if(j==i, B[i, j]=1, B[i, j]=(H^i)[i-1, j]); )); H=B); return((H^(n+1))[k+2, 2])}
xref: Cf. A121427 (diagonal), A121431; rows: A121413, A121417, A121422; related tables: A121424, A121428; related triangles: A121412, A121416, A121420.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 26 2006
